Dear Sheffield City Council,
This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. I would like to request the following information:
1) In the academic years 2021/22, 2022/23, and 2023/24 (so far), how much money was spent by the council on teaching and teaching assistant/support staff at pupil referral units within the council’s remit that were hired via agencies on temporary contracts? Please separate these figures by school year, PRU and supplier.
2) Does the council have a written policy (or policies) that details an approach to mental and physical wellbeing for staff at pupil referral units? If the answer to this question is yes, please share the relevant documentation.
3) In the academic years 2021/22, 2022/23, and 2023/24 (so far), how many times were there incidences of violence towards staff at PRUs under the council's remit? Please separate these figures by school year.
4) What counseling and psychological staff is available to teaching and support staff in the PRUs under your remit? Please detail their qualifications and how many days a week they work.
I would be grateful if you could please confirm receipt of this email.
Kind regards,
Robert Boyd

Dear Robert Boyd,
Thank you for your request for information relating to PRUs which we

This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt

Dear Robert Boyd,
Thank you for your request for information relating to PRUs which we
received on 09/02/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. In the academic years 2021/22, 2022/23, and 2023/24 (so far), how much
money was spent by the council on teaching and teaching
assistant/support staff at pupil referral units within the council’s
remit that were hired via agencies on temporary contracts? Please
separate these figures by school year, PRU and supplier.
• We do not hold information on suppliers. The PRU is responsible for
its own payments.
• The decision on how to spend money on staffing would be made by the
Headteacher and governors.
• Please note, we only have one PRU in the City. The PRU would have to
be contacted directly for this level of detail.
Contact Details:
Sheffield Inclusion Centre
Email: [1][
email address
].u
[2]
https://www.inclusion.sheffield.sch.uk/
2. Does the council have a written policy (or policies) that details an
approach to mental and physical wellbeing for staff at pupil referral
units? If the answer to this question is yes, please share the
relevant documentation.
• This would be the responsibility of the Headteacher in the PRU – see
contact details above.
3. In the academic years 2021/22, 2022/23, and 2023/24 (so far), how many
times were there incidences of violence towards staff at PRUs under
the council's remit? Please separate these figures by school year.
·       We do not record these figures this information would be held by
the school – please contact the PRU direct.
·       We do, however record school related complaints and there has not
been any relating to incidents of violence against staff.
4. What counselling and psychological staff is available to teaching and
support staff in the PRUs under your remit? Please detail their
qualifications and how many days a week they work.
• We do not hold information relating to the specific school
arrangements.
• This would be the responsibility of the Headteacher in the PRU.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [3]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see

https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
